original_title: Sri Lanka’s national inflation down to 33.6-pct in April
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s nation-wide inflation measured by the National Consumer Price Index fell to 33.6 percent in April 2023 from 49.2 percent data showed, as credit was negative and the rupee appreciated.
The NPCI index fell absolutely by 1 percent from 204.8 points in March to 202.7 percent in April.
The index is only 0.3 percent above the September 2022 number of 201.9 points.

Sri Lanka’s private credit is negative and the rupee has been allowed to appreciate from March by the central bank amid overnight liquidity shortages in the banking system amid balance of payments surplus.
A pegged central bank which generates a balance of payments surplus runs deflationary open market operations. (Colombo/May23/2023)
